body:
I  have the same problem below.
```

References underlined with "~~~" are likely causes.
Learn more at https://squ.re/leaks.

┬───

│

​     mDestroyed = false

```
The plan is to tweak this to be more lenient in the next release, and rely on https://github.com/square/curtains to pull out the information to help with this.

issue.title: Another leak in AppCompatSpinner

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
Don't know why leak canary detect this leak. This is a fresh spinner view.

```
====================================
HEAP ANALYSIS RESULT
====================================
1 APPLICATION LEAKS

References underlined with "~~~" are likely causes.
Learn more at https://squ.re/leaks.

1378 bytes retained by leaking objects
Signature: bca9464c09eea690748237771769a842440af
┬───
│ GC Root: Local variable in native code
│
├─ android.os.HandlerThread instance
│    Leaking: NO (PathClassLoader↓ is not leaking)
│    Thread name: 'LeakCanary-Heap-Dump'
│    ↓ Thread.contextClassLoader
├─ dalvik.system.PathClassLoader instance
│    Leaking: NO (InternalLeakCanary↓ is not leaking and A ClassLoader is never
│    leaking)
│    ↓ ClassLoader.runtimeInternalObjects
├─ java.lang.Object[] array
│    Leaking: NO (InternalLeakCanary↓ is not leaking)
│    ↓ Object[].[527]
├─ leakcanary.internal.InternalLeakCanary class
│    Leaking: NO (MainActivity↓ is not leaking and a class is never leaking)
│    ↓ static InternalLeakCanary.resumedActivity
├─ com.leak.myapplication.MainActivity instance
│    Leaking: NO (AppCompatSpinner↓ is not leaking and Activity#mDestroyed is
│    false)
│    mApplication instance of android.app.Application
│    mBase instance of androidx.appcompat.view.ContextThemeWrapper
│    ↓ MainActivity.binding
├─ com.leak.myapplication.databinding.ActivityMainBinding instance
│    Leaking: NO (AppCompatSpinner↓ is not leaking)
│    ↓ ActivityMainBinding.spinner
├─ androidx.appcompat.widget.AppCompatSpinner instance
│    Leaking: NO (View attached)
│    View is part of a window view hierarchy
│    View.mAttachInfo is not null (view attached)
│    View.mID = R.id.spinner
│    View.mWindowAttachCount = 1
│    mPopupContext instance of com.leak.myapplication.MainActivity with
│    mDestroyed = false
│    mContext instance of com.leak.myapplication.MainActivity with mDestroyed =
│    false
│    ↓ AppCompatSpinner.mPopup
│                       ~~~~~~
├─ androidx.appcompat.widget.AppCompatSpinner$DropdownPopup instance
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    Retaining 7.2 kB in 171 objects
│    mContext instance of com.leak.myapplication.MainActivity with mDestroyed =
│    false
│    ↓ ListPopupWindow.mPopup
│                      ~~~~~~
├─ androidx.appcompat.widget.AppCompatPopupWindow instance
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    Retaining 6.9 kB in 160 objects

│    false
│    ↓ PopupWindow.mEnterTransition
│                  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
├─ android.transition.TransitionSet instance
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    Retaining 2.9 kB in 76 objects
│    ↓ Transition.mTargets
│                 ~~~~~~~~
├─ java.util.ArrayList instance
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    Retaining 60 B in 2 objects
│    ↓ ArrayList.elementData
│                ~~~~~~~~~~~
├─ java.lang.Object[] array
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    Retaining 40 B in 1 objects
│    ↓ Object[].[0]
│               ~~~
├─ android.widget.PopupWindow$PopupBackgroundView instance
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    Retaining 2.4 kB in 41 objects
│    View not part of a window view hierarchy
│    View.mAttachInfo is null (view detached)
│    View.mWindowAttachCount = 1
│    mContext instance of com.leak.myapplication.MainActivity with mDestroyed =
│    false

│           ~~~~~~~
╰→ android.widget.PopupWindow$PopupDecorView instance
```

issue.title: Use Curtains for root view leak detection

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
- Remove the internal hacks and leverage the ones in Curtains
- More fine grained approach to root view leak detection with less annoying defaults.
- New leak_canary_watcher_watch_dismissed_dialogs boolean which defaults to false as holding dialogs for reuse seems to be a common pattern.

Fixes #2051

body: https://github.com/square/leakcanary/pull/2082 should fix this and provide default settings that work for yall.

@pyricau I am having exactly the same issue - but from this thread it is not clear if this is a valid leak or a false positive. Can please clarify? Also the recipe for tweaking the retention rules sounds like something you would not wanna do if it is a valid leak

@AnastasiaRainMaker it mostly depends on the leaktrace, but if you're having the exact same one then yes you'll likely want to apply this fix or wait for the release. Sorry I need to release this, I've been busy with other things.

does pr #2082 filter only the reuse of dialog view by default? is there a way to filter resure of my other kinds of view. for now, i get leak saying " view received #onDetachedFromWindow callback. Conflicts with view attatched. attatchInfo is not null, mWindowAttachCount is over 1"
@leinli03 can you try the snapshot version for 2.7? https://square.github.io/leakcanary/faq/#how-do-i-use-the-snapshot-version

> @leinli03 can you try the snapshot version for 2.7? https://square.github.io/leakcanary/faq/#how-do-i-use-the-snapshot-version

it still report the same leak, another leak is also reported, it says "view received #onDetachedFromWindow callback.  attatchInfo is null, mWindowAttachCount is 1". i thought it's should be the fisrt time view detached. And the leak above appearw when view resued.
